page.title: 02LOCAL HOUSING
page.content: LOCAL HOUSING This area of Gloucestershire is very rural. Housing is mainly along the country roads,fronting onto the road. The houses are mostly detached dwellings although there are some semi-detached and there is one row of terraced houses. The materials used for building are mainly brick although some have been rendered. Roofs are built of a variety of materials, slates, clay tiles and concrete tiles. Most houses in the locality are privately owned with just a few council owned properties. Most houses have quite large gardens, one-third of an acre and upwards and most are well kept indicating that gardening is a predominant hobby in the area. Because the area is so rural there is not a lot of demand for new housing and there is no new housing being built.
